page.title: 14LIFE IN THE AREA
page.content: (TRAVELLING FAIR) ARE OVER BUT SUMMER FAIRS ARE HELD ANNUALLY IN THE LOCAL VILLAGES. THE MOST EXCITING EVENT IN LIVING MEMORY APART FROM THE OCCASIONAL ESCAPED BULL APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN THE ALMOST ANNUAL "FLOOD" WHICH OCCUCRRED UNTIL 1947. A DESCRIPTION OF THIS CAN BE FOUND ON A LATER PAGE. THE MOST CONTROVERSIAL TOPIC IN RECENT TIMES OCCURRED WHEN THE COUNCIL GREATLY INCREASED THE CHARGE FOR THE EMPTYING OF CESSPOOLS. NO MAINS DRAINAGE IN THE AREA ,OBLIGES ALL HOUSEHOLDS TO USE THE POOLS. THE SEWAGE TANKERS PULLED BY LOCAL TRACTORS NOW VIE WITH THOSE OF THE COUNCIL ON THE LOCAL ROADS AND LANES.THERE ARE SOME HOUSES TO BE FOUND WHICH HAVE NO WATER SANITATION. THERE IS NO MAINS GAS SUPPLY TO THE AREA BUT SOME PREMISES USE GAS BOTTLES OR TANKS TO SUPPLY GAS FOR COOKING
